content:
SystemColors Class

Definition

Each property of the SystemColors class is a Color structure that is the color of a Windows display element.

In this Article

public sealed class SystemColors
Inheritance
Object
SystemColors

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)
ToString()

Examples

The following code example demonstrates the op_Equality operator and the SystemColors class. This example is designed to be used with a Windows Form that contains a button named Button1. Paste the following code into your form and associate the Button1_Click method with the button's Click event. 

private void Button1_Click(System.Object sender, System.EventArgs e)
{

    if (this.BackColor == SystemColors.ControlDark)
    {
        this.BackColor = SystemColors.Control;
    }
}

void Button1_Click( System::Object^ /*sender*/, System::EventArgs^ /*e*/ )
{
   if ( this->BackColor == SystemColors::ControlDark )
   {
      this->BackColor = SystemColors::Control;
   }
}

Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, _
    ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click

    If (Color.op_Equality(Me.BackColor, SystemColors.ControlDark)) Then
        Me.BackColor = SystemColors.Control
    End If
End Sub

Remarks

Better performance is achieved by using the properties of the SystemPens or SystemBrushes classes rather than creating a new pen or brush based on a value from SystemColors. For example, if you wanted to get a brush for the face color of a 3-D element, use the Control property because it gets a brush that already exists, whereas calling the SolidBrush constructor with a parameter value of Control will create a new brush.

Properties

ActiveBorder

Gets a Color structure that is the color of the active window's border.

public static System.Drawing.Color ActiveBorder { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of the active window's border.

ActiveCaption

Gets a Color structure that is the color of the background of the active window's title bar.

public static System.Drawing.Color ActiveCaption { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of the active window's title bar.

ActiveCaptionText

Gets a Color structure that is the color of the text in the active window's title bar.

public static System.Drawing.Color ActiveCaptionText { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of the text in the active window's title bar.

AppWorkspace

Gets a Color structure that is the color of the application workspace.

public static System.Drawing.Color AppWorkspace { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of the application workspace.

Remarks

The application workspace is the area in a multiple-document view that is not being occupied by documents.

ButtonFace

Gets a Color structure that is the face color of a 3-D element.

public static System.Drawing.Color ButtonFace { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the face color of a 3-D element.

ButtonHighlight

Gets a Color structure that is the highlight color of a 3-D element.

public static System.Drawing.Color ButtonHighlight { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the highlight color of a 3-D element.

Remarks

This color is applied to parts of a 3-D element that face the light source.

ButtonShadow

Gets a Color structure that is the shadow color of a 3-D element.

public static System.Drawing.Color ButtonShadow { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the shadow color of a 3-D element.

Remarks

This color is applied to parts of a 3-D element that face away from the light source.

Control

Gets a Color structure that is the face color of a 3-D element.

public static System.Drawing.Color Control { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the face color of a 3-D element.

ControlDark

Gets a Color structure that is the shadow color of a 3-D element.

public static System.Drawing.Color ControlDark { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the shadow color of a 3-D element.

Remarks

This color is applied to parts of a 3-D element that face away from the light source.

ControlDarkDark

Gets a Color structure that is the dark shadow color of a 3-D element.

public static System.Drawing.Color ControlDarkDark { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the dark shadow color of a 3-D element.

Remarks

This color is applied to the parts of a 3-D element that are the darkest color.

ControlLight

Gets a Color structure that is the light color of a 3-D element.

public static System.Drawing.Color ControlLight { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the light color of a 3-D element.

Remarks

This color is applied to parts of a 3-D element that face the light source.

ControlLightLight

Gets a Color structure that is the highlight color of a 3-D element.

public static System.Drawing.Color ControlLightLight { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the highlight color of a 3-D element.

Remarks

This color is applied to the parts of a 3-D element that are the lightest color.

ControlText

Gets a Color structure that is the color of text in a 3-D element.

public static System.Drawing.Color ControlText { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of text in a 3-D element.

Desktop

Gets a Color structure that is the color of the desktop.

public static System.Drawing.Color Desktop { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of the desktop.

GradientActiveCaption

Gets a Color structure that is the lightest color in the color gradient of an active window's title bar.

public static System.Drawing.Color GradientActiveCaption { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the lightest color in the color gradient of an active window's title bar.

GradientInactiveCaption

Gets a Color structure that is the lightest color in the color gradient of an inactive window's title bar.

public static System.Drawing.Color GradientInactiveCaption { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the lightest color in the color gradient of an inactive window's title bar.

GrayText

Gets a Color structure that is the color of dimmed text.

public static System.Drawing.Color GrayText { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of dimmed text.

Remarks

Items in a list that are disabled are displayed in dimmed text.

Highlight

Gets a Color structure that is the color of the background of selected items.

public static System.Drawing.Color Highlight { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of the background of selected items.

Remarks

Selected items may include menu items as well as selected text. For example, the Color structure may be the color used for the background of selected items in a list box.

HighlightText

Gets a Color structure that is the color of the text of selected items.

public static System.Drawing.Color HighlightText { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of the text of selected items.

Remarks

For example, this color is used for the text of selected items in a list box.

HotTrack

Gets a Color structure that is the color used to designate a hot-tracked item.

public static System.Drawing.Color HotTrack { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color used to designate a hot-tracked item.

Remarks

Single-clicking a hot-tracked item executes the item.

InactiveBorder

Gets a Color structure that is the color of an inactive window's border.

public static System.Drawing.Color InactiveBorder { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of an inactive window's border.

InactiveCaption

Gets a Color structure that is the color of the background of an inactive window's title bar.

public static System.Drawing.Color InactiveCaption { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of the background of an inactive window's title bar.

InactiveCaptionText

Gets a Color structure that is the color of the text in an inactive window's title bar.

public static System.Drawing.Color InactiveCaptionText { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of the text in an inactive window's title bar.

Info

Gets a Color structure that is the color of the background of a ToolTip.

public static System.Drawing.Color Info { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of the background of a ToolTip.

InfoText

Gets a Color structure that is the color of the text of a ToolTip.

public static System.Drawing.Color InfoText { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of the text of a ToolTip.

Menu

Gets a Color structure that is the color of a menu's background.

public static System.Drawing.Color Menu { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of a menu's background.

MenuBar

Gets a Color structure that is the color of the background of a menu bar.

public static System.Drawing.Color MenuBar { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of the background of a menu bar.

MenuHighlight

Gets a Color structure that is the color used to highlight menu items when the menu appears as a flat menu.

public static System.Drawing.Color MenuHighlight { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color used to highlight menu items when the menu appears as a flat menu.

MenuText

Gets a Color structure that is the color of a menu's text.

public static System.Drawing.Color MenuText { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of a menu's text.

ScrollBar

Gets a Color structure that is the color of the background of a scroll bar.

public static System.Drawing.Color ScrollBar { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of the background of a scroll bar.

Window

Gets a Color structure that is the color of the background in the client area of a window.

public static System.Drawing.Color Window { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of the background in the client area of a window.

WindowFrame

Gets a Color structure that is the color of a window frame.

public static System.Drawing.Color WindowFrame { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of a window frame.

WindowText

Gets a Color structure that is the color of the text in the client area of a window.

public static System.Drawing.Color WindowText { get; }
Value
Color

A Color that is the color of the text in the client area of a window.
